trans-unit.source: Construction Order Lines

seg-source.mrk: Construction Order Lines

trans-unit.source: When the construction order is opened, the lines cannot be edited. On the ribbon, click Construction Line to open an editable overview of the construction lines. The BOM in the construction lines is always presented as a multi-level BOM.

seg-source.mrk: When the construction order is opened, the lines cannot be edited.
On the ribbon, click Construction Line to open an editable overview of the construction lines.
The BOM in the construction lines is always presented as a multi-level BOM.

trans-unit.source: : Construction BOM page

seg-source.mrk: : Construction BOM page

trans-unit.source: The fields on the Construction BOM page are described in the following table.

seg-source.mrk: The fields on the Construction BOM page are described in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Field

seg-source.mrk: Field

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: Entry No.

seg-source.mrk: Entry No.

trans-unit.source: System-generated number of the BOM line. This number cannot be changed.

seg-source.mrk: System-generated number of the BOM line.
This number cannot be changed.

trans-unit.source: Belongs to Entry No.

seg-source.mrk: Belongs to Entry No.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the higher-level BOM item to which the current line belongs. The field cannot be edited.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the higher-level BOM item to which the current line belongs.
The field cannot be edited.

trans-unit.source: Separate Prod. Order

seg-source.mrk: Separate Prod.
Order

trans-unit.source: Defaults from the Item Card or from the master BOM and can be changed here as needed. This field controls whether a separate production order is created for this line when a production order is generated.

seg-source.mrk: Defaults from the Item Card or from the master BOM and can be changed here as needed.
This field controls whether a separate production order is created for this line when a production order is generated.

trans-unit.source: Level Line No.

seg-source.mrk: Level Line No.

trans-unit.source: Sequential numbering of all BOM lines of a level. The field cannot be edited.

seg-source.mrk: Sequential numbering of all BOM lines of a level.
The field cannot be edited.

trans-unit.source: Level

seg-source.mrk: Level

trans-unit.source: Specifies the level of the BOM structure to which the line is assigned. The field cannot be edited.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the level of the BOM structure to which the line is assigned.
The field cannot be edited.

trans-unit.source: Position, Position 2 and Position 3

seg-source.mrk: Position, Position 2 and Position 3

trans-unit.source: Specifies the position number. These fields are used to enter the drawing position numbers of an associated CAD or design drawing.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the position number.
These fields are used to enter the drawing position numbers of an associated CAD or design drawing.

trans-unit.source: Status

seg-source.mrk: Status

trans-unit.source: The current status of the BOM line. This field controls if the current line is included in supply planning by the system (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="General FastTab.htm#_Ref406771388" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“General FastTab” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) or if a production order can be generated. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: The current status of the BOM line.

This field controls if the current line is included in supply planning by the system (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="General FastTab.htm#_Ref406771388" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“General FastTab” on page 1</MadCap:xref>) or if a production order can be generated.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: Open – Lines with this status are neither included in supply planning (can be set in the Configure to Order Setup page), nor can a production order be generated via open lines.

seg-source.mrk: Open – Lines with this status are neither included in supply planning (can be set in the Configure to Order Setup page), nor can a production order be generated via open lines.

trans-unit.source: Released – Lines with this status are included in supply planning if this is defined in the Configure to Order Setup page. A production order can be generated via released lines.

seg-source.mrk: Released – Lines with this status are included in supply planning if this is defined in the Configure to Order Setup page.
A production order can be generated via released lines.

trans-unit.source: Closed – This status must be set manually.

seg-source.mrk: Closed – This status must be set manually.

trans-unit.source: Type

seg-source.mrk: Type

trans-unit.source: Identifies the type of BOM line. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Identifies the type of BOM line.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: <blank> – This option is used mainly to insert a comment in a manufacturing BOM line.

seg-source.mrk: <blank> – This option is used mainly to insert a comment in a manufacturing BOM line.

trans-unit.source: Account (G/L) – Selection of a G/L account.

seg-source.mrk: Account (G/L) – Selection of a G/L account.

trans-unit.source:
Item – This option enables an item from the item master to be entered as a BOM component.
  • When an item has a master BOM itself, this is taken into consideration automatically and transferred to the construction BOM if the Part Type field is set to Production in the item master. When an item is entered manually, and if it has its own master BOM, this can be opened by clicking Request BOM from Line on the ribbon and then transferred to the construction BOM.
  • If the Part Type field is set to Standard, the item is treated as in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV.
  • If the Part Type field is set to Purchase and the status of a Construction Line changes to Released, a new Variant Code gets inserted to the Variant Code field in the BOM line.

seg-source.mrk: Item – This option enables an item from the item master to be entered as a BOM component.
• When an item has a master BOM itself, this is taken into consideration automatically and transferred to the construction BOM if the Part Type field is set to Production in the item master.
When an item is entered manually, and if it has its own master BOM, this can be opened by clicking Request BOM from Line on the ribbon and then transferred to the construction BOM.
• If the Part Type field is set to Standard, the item is treated as in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV.
• If the Part Type field is set to Purchase and the status of a Construction Line changes to Released, a new Variant Code gets inserted to the Variant Code field in the BOM line.

trans-unit.source: If the Information Line check box is selected for the BOM type in the document BOM configuration, then the components from items with the Part Type field <> Standard or Purchase are also copied into the Construction Line.

seg-source.mrk: If the Information Line check box is selected for the BOM type in the document BOM configuration, then the components from items with the Part Type field <> Standard or Purchase are also copied into the Construction Line.

trans-unit.source: Resource – This option enables a resource to be selected. The use of resources in the master BOM is relevant if the capacity and value of indirect areas (e.g. construction) are also to be considered in the BOM.

seg-source.mrk: Resource – This option enables a resource to be selected.
The use of resources in the master BOM is relevant if the capacity and value of indirect areas (e.g. construction) are also to be considered in the BOM.

trans-unit.source: Work Center – Selection of a work center for a series of operations.

seg-source.mrk: Work Center – Selection of a work center for a series of operations.

trans-unit.source: Machine Center – Selection of a machine center for a series of operations.

seg-source.mrk: Machine Center – Selection of a machine center for a series of operations.

trans-unit.source: Master BOM – Selection of a Master BOM. The components of this Master BOM will not be transferred as its own assembly group, but will be copied directly into the current BOM level.

seg-source.mrk: Master BOM – Selection of a Master BOM.
The components of this Master BOM will not be transferred as its own assembly group, but will be copied directly into the current BOM level.

trans-unit.source: Production BOM – Used with the integration to cc|process manufacturing (refer to section “cc|process manufacturing” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Production BOM – Used with the integration to cc|process manufacturing (refer to section “cc|process manufacturing” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: No.

seg-source.mrk: No.

trans-unit.source: Number of the relevant item, resource, work center, machine center, G/L account, or master BOM.

seg-source.mrk: Number of the relevant item, resource, work center, machine center, G/L account, or master BOM.

trans-unit.source: Formula Quantity

seg-source.mrk: Formula Quantity

trans-unit.source: Defaults from the master BOM.

seg-source.mrk: Defaults from the master BOM.

trans-unit.source: Entry No. Representation

seg-source.mrk: Entry No.
Representation

trans-unit.source: All lines are numbered sequentially by the system in order to present them in the correct order. The field cannot be edited.

seg-source.mrk: All lines are numbered sequentially by the system in order to present them in the correct order.
The field cannot be edited.

trans-unit.source: Sub BOM

seg-source.mrk: Sub BOM

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether the line has a substructure in the document BOM or construction order. Any master or manufacturing BOM that exists for the item is not displayed.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates whether the line has a substructure in the document BOM or construction order.
Any master or manufacturing BOM that exists for the item is not displayed.

trans-unit.source: Description – Description 5

seg-source.mrk: Description – Description 5

trans-unit.source: Item descriptions from the Item Card. The item descriptions are copied into the master BOM and can be changed here as required.

seg-source.mrk: Item descriptions from the Item Card.
The item descriptions are copied into the master BOM and can be changed here as required.

trans-unit.source: Calculation Group Code

seg-source.mrk: Calculation Group Code

trans-unit.source: Groups items, work centers, machine centers, resources, or G/L accounts for calculation purposes (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Calculation Groups in Order.htm#_Ref310435968" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Calculation Groups in Order-Related BOMs” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Groups items, work centers, machine centers, resources, or G/L accounts for calculation purposes (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Calculation Groups in Order.htm#_Ref310435968" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Calculation Groups in Order-Related BOMs” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Routing Link Code

seg-source.mrk: Routing Link Code

trans-unit.source: Connects material with a series of operations. In cc|configure to order, the Routing Link Code is used to assign material provided for an external manufacturing step.

seg-source.mrk: Connects material with a series of operations.
In cc|configure to order, the Routing Link Code is used to assign material provided for an external manufacturing step.

trans-unit.source: Standard Task Code

seg-source.mrk: Standard Task Code

trans-unit.source: Indicates the Standard Task Code for the construction BOM line.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the Standard Task Code for the construction BOM line.

trans-unit.source: Variant Code

seg-source.mrk: Variant Code

trans-unit.source: Number of the item variant if a variant item is selected.

seg-source.mrk: Number of the item variant if a variant item is selected.

trans-unit.source: Calculation Formula

seg-source.mrk: Calculation Formula

trans-unit.source: Determines how to calculate the Quantity field. The options are:

seg-source.mrk: Determines how to calculate the Quantity field.
The options are:

trans-unit.source: <blank>

seg-source.mrk: <blank>

trans-unit.source: Quantity = Quantity per

seg-source.mrk: Quantity = Quantity per

trans-unit.source: Length

seg-source.mrk: Length

trans-unit.source: Quantity = Length * Quantity per

seg-source.mrk: Quantity = Length * Quantity per

trans-unit.source: Length * Width

seg-source.mrk: Length * Width

trans-unit.source: Quantity = Length * Width * Quantity per

seg-source.mrk: Quantity = Length * Width * Quantity per

trans-unit.source: Length * Width * Depth

seg-source.mrk: Length * Width * Depth

trans-unit.source: Quantity = Length * Width * Depth * Quantity per

seg-source.mrk: Quantity = Length * Width * Depth * Quantity per

trans-unit.source: Weight

seg-source.mrk: Weight

trans-unit.source: Quantity = Weight * Quantity per

trans-unit.source: Quantity per

seg-source.mrk: Quantity per

trans-unit.source: Here can be entered a quantity per.

seg-source.mrk: Here can be entered a quantity per.

trans-unit.source: Qty. per Unit of Measure

seg-source.mrk: Qty.
per Unit of Measure

trans-unit.source: Specification of the quantity in relation to the single value of the base unit.

seg-source.mrk: Specification of the quantity in relation to the single value of the base unit.

trans-unit.source: Quantity

seg-source.mrk: Quantity

trans-unit.source: Quantity that is needed by the component to manufacture a unit of a higher level item.

seg-source.mrk: Quantity that is needed by the component to manufacture a unit of a higher level item.

trans-unit.source: The application updates this field automatically based on the Quantity per field and – and if the Calculation Formula field was filled in – the values in the Length, Width, Weight and/or Depth fields.

seg-source.mrk: The application updates this field automatically based on the Quantity per field and – and if the Calculation Formula field was filled in – the values in the Length, Width, Weight and/or Depth fields.

trans-unit.source: Exp. Quantity

seg-source.mrk: Exp.
Quantity

trans-unit.source: Expected quantity of the position. If the Quantity per field is filled and/or in the Formula field, an option other than is selected, the Exp. Quantity is based on the higher level item and the quantity of the line.

seg-source.mrk: Expected quantity of the position.
If the Quantity per field is filled and/or in the Formula field, an option other than is selected, the Exp.
Quantity is based on the higher level item and the quantity of the line.

trans-unit.source: For work centers and machine centers, this field is used for calculating the time requirement according to the following formula:

seg-source.mrk: For work centers and machine centers, this field is used for calculating the time requirement according to the following formula:

trans-unit.source: Time requirement = Tr + Te/Lot size * Exp. quantity

seg-source.mrk: Time requirement = Tr + Te/Lot size * Exp.
quantity

trans-unit.source: Setup Time

seg-source.mrk: Setup Time

trans-unit.source: Setup time for the series of operations (only relevant with the Type field set to Work Center or Machine Center).

seg-source.mrk: Setup time for the series of operations (only relevant with the Type field set to Work Center or Machine Center).

seg-source.mrk: Setup Time Unit of Meas.
Code

trans-unit.source: Run Time

seg-source.mrk: Run Time

trans-unit.source: Processing time for the series of operations (only relevant with the Type field set to Work Center or Machine Center).

trans-unit.source: Run Time Unit of Meas. Code

Code

trans-unit.source: Lot Size

seg-source.mrk: Lot Size

trans-unit.source: Lot size in which the component is manufactured and to which the run time relates (only relevant when work centers or groups of work centers are used).

The setting can be changed as needed.

Quantity field.

Quantity (Base)

The application automatically completes this field.

The application automatically completes this field.

trans-unit.source: Part Type

seg-source.mrk: Part Type

trans-unit.source: The part type of the item (does not apply for capacity items and resources). Defaults from the Item Card, Document BOM or Master BOM depending on how the Construction Order was created; can be changed as needed.

seg-source.mrk: The part type of the item (does not apply for capacity items and resources).
Defaults from the Item Card, Document BOM or Master BOM depending on how the Construction Order was created; can be changed as needed.

trans-unit.source: Unit Cost (CC)

seg-source.mrk: Unit Cost (CC)

trans-unit.source: Cost price of the BOM line. The cost price is either defaulted from the master data or calculated from the configuration (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Example Cost Price Calculation.htm#_Ref406766193" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Cost Price Calculation” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Cost price of the BOM line.

The cost price is either defaulted from the master data or calculated from the configuration (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Example Cost Price Calculation.htm#_Ref406766193" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Cost Price Calculation” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Unit Amount

trans-unit.source: Information Line

seg-source.mrk: Information Line

trans-unit.source: Corresponds to the Part Type field on the Item Card (refer to topic “Config. to Order FastTab” on page 1). If the item has the Part Type of Production, it is not relevant for requirements itself, but is relevant for its sub-items. In this case, the Information Line check box is selected.

seg-source.mrk: Corresponds to the Part Type field on the Item Card (refer to topic “Config. to Order FastTab” on page 1).
If the item has the Part Type of Production, it is not relevant for requirements itself, but is relevant for its sub-items.
In this case, the Information Line check box is selected.

trans-unit.source: Shipment Date

seg-source.mrk: Shipment Date

trans-unit.source: The date on which the component must be available. This date is the same as the Shipment Date on the General FastTab but can be recalculated with the “Schedule” function. Generally, it is dependent on the start date of the series of operations (refer to the Starting Date field). The value proposed by the system can be changed manually.

seg-source.mrk: The date on which the component must be available.
This date is the same as the Shipment Date on the General FastTab but can be recalculated with the “Schedule” function.
Generally, it is dependent on the start date of the series of operations (refer to the Starting Date field).
The value proposed by the system can be changed manually.

trans-unit.source: Starting Date

seg-source.mrk: Starting Date

trans-unit.source: Calculated through the “Schedule” function. In the case of series of operations (Type field is set to Work Center, Machine Center, or Resource) the start date of the series of operations is entered here. The field can be changed manually.

seg-source.mrk: Calculated through the “Schedule” function.
In the case of series of operations (Type field is set to Work Center, Machine Center, or Resource) the start date of the series of operations is entered here.
The field can be changed manually.

trans-unit.source: Ending Date

seg-source.mrk: Ending Date

trans-unit.source: Calculated through the “Schedule” function. In the case of series of operations (Type field is set to Work Center, Machine Center, or Resource) the end date of the series of operations is entered here. The field can be changed manually.

seg-source.mrk: Calculated through the “Schedule” function.
In the case of series of operations (Type field is set to Work Center, Machine Center, or Resource) the end date of the series of operations is entered here.
The field can be changed manually.

trans-unit.source: Due Date

seg-source.mrk: Due Date

trans-unit.source: Calculated through the “Schedule” function. In the case of items, the due date of the components is entered here. The field can be changed manually.

seg-source.mrk: Calculated through the “Schedule” function.
In the case of items, the due date of the components is entered here.
The field can be changed manually.

seg-source.mrk: The amount of the line discount.

trans-unit.source: Assembly Date

seg-source.mrk: Assembly Date

trans-unit.source: The assembly date is an additional date field used for information purposes. No functionality depends on this field.

No functionality depends on this field.

trans-unit.source: Drawing

seg-source.mrk: Drawing

trans-unit.source: If selected, there is a drawing linked to this item.

trans-unit.source: Production Lead Time

seg-source.mrk: Production Lead Time

trans-unit.source: A lead time can be entered here. When a production order is generated from the construction order, the value entered here is taken over as the lead time for the component in the production order.

seg-source.mrk: A lead time can be entered here.
When a production order is generated from the construction order, the value entered here is taken over as the lead time for the component in the production order.

trans-unit.source: Scrap %

seg-source.mrk: Scrap %

trans-unit.source: A scrap percentage can be entered here. When a production order is generated from the construction order, the value entered here for the component is transferred to the Scrap % field of the production order.

seg-source.mrk: A scrap percentage can be entered here.
When a production order is generated from the construction order, the value entered here for the component is transferred to the Scrap % field of the production order.

trans-unit.source: Base Material

seg-source.mrk: Base Material

trans-unit.source: A base material can be entered here. If a base material is already assigned to the item card, it will default to the construction BOM when created.

seg-source.mrk: A base material can be entered here.
If a base material is already assigned to the item card, it will default to the construction BOM when created.

trans-unit.source: Text Set ID

seg-source.mrk: Text Set ID

trans-unit.source: Indicates the ID of any text from the cc|text module that has been entered for the construction BOM line.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the ID of any text from the cc|text module that has been entered for the construction BOM line.

trans-unit.source: Production View Link

seg-source.mrk: Production View Link

trans-unit.source: Identifies the production view code for the assembly unit that will be linked to the component (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Example Production View.htm#_Ref418157755" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Production View” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Identifies the production view code for the assembly unit that will be linked to the component (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Example Production View.htm#_Ref418157755" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Production View” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Belongs to Prod. View Link

seg-source.mrk: Belongs to Prod.
View Link

trans-unit.source: Indicates which assembly unit this component is linked to and thus will become part of its configuration when viewing the construction order in the production view (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Example Production View.htm#_Ref418157761" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Production View” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates which assembly unit this component is linked to and thus will become part of its configuration when viewing the construction order in the production view (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Example Production View.htm#_Ref418157761" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Production View” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Separate Delivery

seg-source.mrk: Separate Delivery

trans-unit.source: Determines if the component is planned for a separate delivery (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Separate Delivery of Semi.htm#_Ref277407514" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Separate Delivery of Semi-Finished Goods” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Determines if the component is planned for a separate delivery (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Separate Delivery of Semi.htm#_Ref277407514" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Separate Delivery of Semi-Finished Goods” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Schedule Manually

seg-source.mrk: Schedule Manually

trans-unit.source: If selected, the line is not included in the “Schedule” function.

seg-source.mrk: If selected, the line is not included in the “Schedule” function.

trans-unit.source: Source

seg-source.mrk: Source

trans-unit.source: Displays the BOM type of the master BOM from which the item is opened.

seg-source.mrk: Displays the BOM type of the master BOM from which the item is opened.

trans-unit.source: Order Tracking Relevance

seg-source.mrk: Order Tracking Relevance

trans-unit.source: Internal application field that is used for calculations within requirements planning.

seg-source.mrk: Internal application field that is used for calculations within requirements planning.

trans-unit.source: Copy BOM to Text

seg-source.mrk: Copy BOM to Text

trans-unit.source: Determines if the BOM will be copied to the purchase line text for a purchased item that is internally designed (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Purchasing of Internally Designed.htm#_Ref310330883" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Purchasing of Internally Designed Items” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Determines if the BOM will be copied to the purchase line text for a purchased item that is internally designed (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Purchasing of Internally Designed.htm#_Ref310330883" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Purchasing of Internally Designed Items” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Purchase Exists

seg-source.mrk: Purchase Exists

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether there is an open purchase quote/order or requisition line for a G/L account or component (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Create Purchase Order or Purchase.htm#_Ref310440354" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Create Purchase Documents for G/L Account and Components” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates whether there is an open purchase quote/order or requisition line for a G/L account or component (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Create Purchase Order or Purchase.htm#_Ref310440354" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Create Purchase Documents for G/L Account and Components” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Purchase Status

seg-source.mrk: Purchase Status

trans-unit.source: Indicates whether a purchase quote/order or requisition line for a G/L account or component has been created or has been posted (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Create Purchase Order or Purchase.htm#_Ref310440361" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Create Purchase Documents for G/L Account and Components” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

seg-source.mrk: Indicates whether a purchase quote/order or requisition line for a G/L account or component has been created or has been posted (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Create Purchase Order or Purchase.htm#_Ref310440361" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Create Purchase Documents for G/L Account and Components” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Dimension Set ID

seg-source.mrk: Dimension Set ID

trans-unit.source: Indicates the ID of any dimensions that have been entered for the construction BOM line.

seg-source.mrk: Indicates the ID of any dimensions that have been entered for the construction BOM line.

trans-unit.source: Attributes

seg-source.mrk: Attributes

trans-unit.source: Displays all attributes that have been entered for the construction BOM line.

seg-source.mrk: Displays all attributes that have been entered for the construction BOM line.

trans-unit.source: Operation No. / Previous Operation No. / Next Operation No.

seg-source.mrk: Operation No.
/ Previous Operation No.
/ Next Operation No.

trans-unit.source: Offers the same function as in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV routings. In the Construction BOM, these fields only work if Type = Work Center or Machine Center.

seg-source.mrk: Offers the same function as in standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV routings.
In the Construction BOM, these fields only work if Type = Work Center or Machine Center.

trans-unit.source: Refer to <MadCap:xref href="Example Parallel Routings in CTO BOMs.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Parallel Routings in CTO BOMs” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Parallel Operation No.

trans-unit.source: Provides a simplified process for defining parallel routings (refer to <MadCap:xref href="Example Parallel Routings in CTO BOMs.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Parallel Routings in CTO BOMs” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Type Production Structure

seg-source.mrk: Type Production Structure

trans-unit.source: Used with the integration to cc|process manufacturing (refer to section “cc|process manufacturing” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: Construction BOM Menus

seg-source.mrk: Construction BOM Menus

trans-unit.source: On the Construction BOM page, various options for editing a construction order are available on menus accessed from the Navigate and Actions tabs. Each are described in the following sections.

seg-source.mrk: On the Construction BOM page, various options for editing a construction order are available on menus accessed from the Navigate and Actions tabs.
Each are described in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: Navigate Tab

seg-source.mrk: Navigate Tab

trans-unit.source: The following menu items appear on the Navigate tab of the Construction BOM ribbon.

seg-source.mrk: The following menu items appear on the Navigate tab of the Construction BOM ribbon.

trans-unit.source: Move Left: Moves the marked position up one level in the BOM structure.

seg-source.mrk: Move Left: Moves the marked position up one level in the BOM structure.

trans-unit.source: Move Right: Moves the marked position down one level in the BOM structure.

seg-source.mrk: Move Right: Moves the marked position down one level in the BOM structure.

trans-unit.source: Open Next Level: In a multi-level BOM, opens a new page that displays entries of the next level only.

seg-source.mrk: Open Next Level: In a multi-level BOM, opens a new page that displays entries of the next level only.

trans-unit.source: Attributes: Opens the attributes that were assigned to the construction line. Attributes can also be assigned manually here.

seg-source.mrk: Attributes: Opens the attributes that were assigned to the construction line.
Attributes can also be assigned manually here.

trans-unit.source: Characteristic Search Tree: Refer to topic “Search Characteristics” on page 1.

seg-source.mrk: Characteristic Search Tree: Refer to topic “Search Characteristics” on page 1.

trans-unit.source: Item Tracking Lines: Here item tracking can be assigned to components that are subject to management in batches or by serial numbers; standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV functionality.

seg-source.mrk: Item Tracking Lines: Here item tracking can be assigned to components that are subject to management in batches or by serial numbers; standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV functionality.

trans-unit.source: Open File: Opens the file specified in the Drawing field for the current line.

seg-source.mrk: Open File: Opens the file specified in the Drawing field for the current line.

trans-unit.source: Comments: Comments can be informatively entered; standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV standard.

seg-source.mrk: Comments: Comments can be informatively entered; standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV standard.

trans-unit.source: Dimensions: Displays the dimensions assigned to the construction order line.

seg-source.mrk: Dimensions: Displays the dimensions assigned to the construction order line.

trans-unit.source: Tools: Tools information can be informatively entered; standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: Tools: Tools information can be informatively entered; standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Personnel: Personnel information can be informatively entered; standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: Personnel: Personnel information can be informatively entered; standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Quality Measures: Quality measures can be informatively entered; standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: Quality Measures: Quality measures can be informatively entered; standard Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Line Texts: Opens the Edit Text page where line-related text can be stored. Refer to topic “cc|text module” on page 1 for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Line Texts: Opens the Edit Text page where line-related text can be stored.
Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="cc text module.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“cc|text module” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Actions Tab

seg-source.mrk: Actions Tab

trans-unit.source: The following menu items appear on the Actions tab of the Construction BOM ribbon.

seg-source.mrk: The following menu items appear on the Actions tab of the Construction BOM ribbon.

trans-unit.source: Request BOM: This function enables the complete master BOM of the item in the construction header to be opened. However, to do this all the construction lines must be deleted first. If the configuration feature is being used, the entries in the document checklist are considered (refer to topic “Configuration” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Request BOM: This function enables the complete master BOM of the item in the construction header to be opened.
However, to do this all the construction lines must be deleted first.

If the configuration feature is being used, the entries in the document checklist are considered (refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Configuration.htm#_Ref351308209" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Configuration” on page 1</MadCap:xref>).

trans-unit.source: Request BOM from Line: This function opens the Master BOM for the component in a document BOM line, if it has its own master BOM.

seg-source.mrk: Request BOM from Line: This function opens the Master BOM for the component in a document BOM line, if it has its own master BOM.

trans-unit.source: Cut: This function enables individual items, multiple items and complete structures from the same or a different construction order to be cut and copied to the clipboard.

seg-source.mrk: Cut: This function enables individual items, multiple items and complete structures from the same or a different construction order to be cut and copied to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: Copy: This function enables individual items, multiple items and complete structures from the same or a different construction order to be copied to the clipboard.

seg-source.mrk: Copy: This function enables individual items, multiple items and complete structures from the same or a different construction order to be copied to the clipboard.

trans-unit.source: Paste: If a line was copied to the clipboard from the same or a different construction order it can be inserted here. Individual items, multiple items and complete structures can be inserted.

seg-source.mrk: Paste: If a line was copied to the clipboard from the same or a different construction order it can be inserted here.
Individual items, multiple items and complete structures can be inserted.

trans-unit.source: Assign New Line No.: This function enables the lines of the construction order to be renumbered. This is necessary when no further new lines can be added to the construction order using the “Auto Split Key” function of Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: Assign New Line No.: This function enables the lines of the construction order to be renumbered.
This is necessary when no further new lines can be added to the construction order using the “Auto Split Key” function of Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Order Promising: This function enables, for example, critical parts or long-running items to be planned in advance. This function is based on the standard order promising functionality. The system calculates the earliest possible procurement date. If you accept the proposal, planning proposals are generated immediately which are connected with the document BOM line or the construction line via the reservation management of Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

seg-source.mrk: Order Promising: This function enables, for example, critical parts or long-running items to be planned in advance.
This function is based on the standard order promising functionality.
The system calculates the earliest possible procurement date.

If you accept the proposal, planning proposals are generated immediately which are connected with the document BOM line or the construction line via the reservation management of Microsoft Dynamics NAV.

trans-unit.source: Update Unit Cost & Price: Updates the unit cost and unit price of lines (Type <> G/L Account, Purchase Status <> Purchase Posted) with the current costs and prices. If something has really changed, the Changed field will be set to TRUE while the page is open. Refer to topic “Example – Update Unit Costs/Prices in CTO BOMs” on page 1 for more information.

seg-source.mrk: Update Unit Cost & Price: Updates the unit cost and unit price of lines (Type <> G/L Account, Purchase Status <> Purchase Posted) with the current costs and prices.
If something has really changed, the Changed field will be set to TRUE while the page is open.

Refer to topic <MadCap:xref href="Example Update Unit Costs Prices in.htm" xmlns:MadCap="http://www.madcapsoftware.com/Schemas/MadCap.xsd">“Example – Update Unit Costs/Prices in CTO BOMs” on page 1</MadCap:xref> for more information.

trans-unit.source: Reserve: This function enables reservations to be made manually (e.g. from the warehouse stock).

seg-source.mrk: Reserve: This function enables reservations to be made manually (e.g. from the warehouse stock).

trans-unit.source: Reserve Ledger Entry: Displays the reserved quantity when reservation items have been generated for this position (e.g. via the date of promised delivery).

seg-source.mrk: Reserve Ledger Entry: Displays the reserved quantity when reservation items have been generated for this position (e.g. via the date of promised delivery).

trans-unit.source: Purchase G/L Acc./Item: Creates a purchase quote/order or requisition line for a component or against a G/L account for an item that does not yet exist for demand and normally would never be created (refer to topic “Create Purchase Documents for G/L Account and Components” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: Purchase G/L Acc./Item: Creates a purchase quote/order or requisition line for a component or against a G/L account for an item that does not yet exist for demand and normally would never be created (refer to topic “Create Purchase Documents for G/L Account and Components” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: Switch Const.-/Prod. View: This function switches between the construction view and the production view (refer to topic “Example – Production View” on page 1).

seg-source.mrk: <span class="Underline">Switch Const.-/Prod.
View: This function switches between the construction view and the production view (refer to topic “Example – Production View” on page 1).

trans-unit.source: Print BOM: Generates a printout of the construction BOM lines.

seg-source.mrk: Print BOM: Generates a printout of the construction BOM lines.
